page.title: 01SOUTH-WEST BRISTOL
page.content: The block is situated on gently rising ground to the south and west of central Bristol.There are prominent {slopes}at Bedminster Down and Novers Common. The area is dissected by the valleys of Colliters Brook,the Malago and Pigeonhouse stream. The{landcover}is predominantly residential with a mixture of commercial,industrial and open space.The residential areas consist of late Victorian terraces;inter-war semi-detached houses and mixed housing developments of the 1960's and 1970's. Most of the{industry}and commerce is situated on trading estates.The largest single industrial site is the factory of the Wills' Company on Hartcliffe Way The block is crossed by several {transport}routes-the main western
